ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Invoking operations on current job  (embedded)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Thats true. ... Where are they coming from?  (I d guess they are because you re invoking operations against a null bean -- and you re getting the null bean

Shifra Raffel wrote:
> Ah -- I was using CrawlJob from what I think was the 1.6 release, and
> preRegister was simpler then. 
Thats true.

> More from me after some more experimentation.
> I've gotten nothing but unhelpful nullPointerExceptions with 
> uninformative
> stack traces so far.
>
Where are they coming from?  (I'd guess they are because you're invoking 
operations against a null bean -- and you're getting the null bean 
because you were using incorrect name when asking the mbeanserver for 
the crawljob).
> >>Another thing you might look at is that in the example you give above,
> >you go direct to the Heritrix instance whereas in the progressStatistics
> >example later, you are going via the MBeanServer.   Is that
> >intentional?  Do one or the other I'd say and if the former, just go
> >direct to the methods that Heritrix#invoke uses internally; this way
> >you'll get a compile-time error rather than a runtime error if we change
> >the API.
>
> I'm probably being thick, but I don't see how it works to call
> Heritrix#invoke (rather than the MBeanServer) to do CrawlJob operations.
> Please point me to what I must be overlooking.
You can embed Heritrix and call directly call methods on  your embedded 
instance or you can go via an indirection and make calls against the 
mbeanserver that Heritrix has registered all instances and all crawl 
jobs with.   Going by yesterday's psuedo-code, it looks like you've 
fallen in between: First you went 'direct' invoking the JMX handler code 
on your Heritrix instance directory -- embeddedHeritrix.invoke(...) -- 
and then you tried to go via the MBeanServer with 
embeddedHeritrix.getMBeanServer().invoke(...).

Advantage of going via the MBeanServer is that you are removed from 
Heritrix internals and clients can be local running inside same JVM or 
remote.  Here's sample code: 
http://crawler.archive.org/cmdline-jmxclient/xref/index.html.  
Disadvantage is all of the JMX marshalling/unmarshalling code but, the 
hcc -- Heritrix Cluster Controller -- can help in this regard: 
http://crawler.archive.org/hcc/apidocs/index.html (Its what we're using 
internally controlling the multiple Heritrix instances in our 
archive-it.org service and what we hope to build on making a controller 
for multimachine crawling).

Otherwise, just call the embeddedHeritrix methods directly.

Maybe, Shifra, we should work on a wiki page together on embedding 
Heritrix?  Write me offlist if interested.

St.Ack
